description: This JSON Schema describes the metadata of a Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) image in order to reproduce the measurement. The cardinality (required or optional) of all metadata is defined and wherever possible a list of controlled vocabularies is provided. Contributors: Reetu Elza Joseph (KIT - SCC), Aditya Chauhan (KIT-IMT), Catriona Eschke (Hereon - Institute of Metallic Biomaterials), Michael Engstler (Saarland University), Jonas Fell (Saarland University), Ahmad Zainul Ihsan(Forschungszentrum J체lich - IAS-9), Mehrdad Jalali (KIT - INT), Ute J채ntsch (KIT - IAM-AWP), Nicole Jung (KIT - IBCS-FMS), C.N. Shyam Kumar (CEA Saclay - SRMP), Christian K체bel (KIT -INT, TU-Darmstadt, KNMF), Christian Lucas (Hereon - Institute of Metallic Biomaterials), Matthias Mail(KIT - INT, KNMF), Andrey Mazilkin (KIT - INT), Charlotte Neidiger (KIT - INT), Mirco Panighel (CNR-IOM Trieste), Christoph Pauly (Saarland University), Stefan Sandfeld (Forschungszentrum J체lich - IAS-9), Torsten Scherer (KIT-INT), Sabine Schlabach (KIT-INT), Rainer Stotzka (KIT - SCC), Richard Thelen (KIT -IMT), Rossella Aversa (KIT - SCC),
title: sem

entry.description: The entry level is the root element of the schema. It contains all the metadata describing a single image measured. The design of the schema is modular: in case of multiple measurements, an entry for each measurement can be included.

technique.description: (Required) - Any experimental, theoretical or computational method used during Data Acquisition or during any of the processes included in the Data Analysis Lifecycle to acquire, process or analyse Research Data about a System or a set of them with an Instrument, which is used to generate this metadata.

enum: completeness check (presence or absence of given properties)
correlative characterization (dedicated sample treatment to emphasise given features)
test specific hypothesis (focus only on given aspects)

equipment.description: (Optional) - Any kind of physical or virtual item, device, machine or other tools used to perform one or more Fabrication(s), Sample Preparation(s), Model Preparation(s), Data Acquisition(s) and/or any of the processes included in the Data Analysis Lifecycle. Usually, the Equipment is located in a Laboratory hosted by an Institution and/or can be virtually or remotely accessed. Equipment is usually an investment. According to this definition, an Instrument is a particular type of Equipment.

consumables.description: (Optional) - Auxiliary entity used during Fabrication, Sample Preparation or Measurement which has a limited time capacity or is limited in its number of uses before it is disposed of, necessary to the process itself and normally bought from third party manufacturers. Examples are: gloves, syringes, wipes, etching solutions, glass slides, spatulas, weighing paper, two-sided tape.

parentReference.description: If type is 'MetaStore URI' it is possible to easily fill this field in a later stage

entryID.description: entryID (Optional)- Identifier of the measurement usually provided by the project or the laboratory

startTime.description: (Optional)- Start time of the measurement in the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

endTime.description: (Required)- End time of the measurement in the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

program.description: (Optional)- Details concerning the program (or software) used for aquisition

revision.description: (Optional)- Details concerning any revision to the document due to e.g. re-calibration, reprocessing, new analysis, new instrument definition format

user.description: (Required)- The contact information of the user responsible for the measurement

identifierValue.description: (Optional) - String containing the value of an identifier

identifierType.description: (Optional) - Type of the identifier to be selected from: *ROR *GRID *ISNI *URL *DOI *Handle

program.description: (Optional) - Details concerning the program (or software) used for aquisition.

programName.description: (Optional) - Name of the program (or software) used for acquisition

revision.description: (Optional) - Details concerning any revision to the document due to e.g. re-calibration, reprocessing, new analysis, new instrument definition format.

user.description: Contact information of the user responsible for the measurement.

userName.description: (Required) - Full name of the user in the format (Family Name, Given Name)

role.description: (Optional) - Role of the user to be selected from: *Data Curator *Instrument Scientist *Principal Investigator *Project Member *Research User *Site Leader *Work Package Leader

affiliation.description: (Optional) - Details of the institution to which the user is affiliated

ORCID.description: (Optional) - Open Researcher and Contributor ID expressed as a URI

institutionDetails.description: (Optional) - Details of the institution to which the user is affiliated.

institutionID.description: (Optional) - Identifier pertaining to the institution (e.g. ROR)

distanceDetails.description: (Optional) - Describes a distance, size or length.

value.description: (Required) - Value of the distance, size or length

unit.description: (Required) - Unit of the value to be selected from a controlled list (fm, pm, nm, 쨉m, mm, cm, m).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - Qualifier to describe the value (e.g., average, maximum, minimum).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty of the value. Allows to specify whether the uncertainty is absolute or relative.

uncertaintyDetails.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty of the value. Allows to specify whether the uncertainty is absolute or relative. Properties: type (Required) - Type of the uncertainty to be chosen between absolute or relative, value (Required) - value of the uncertainty.

uncertaintyType.description: (Required) - Type of the uncertainty to be chosen between absolute or relative.

unit.description: (Required) - Unit of the value to be selected from a controlled list (ng, 쨉g, mg, g, kg).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - Qualifier to describe the value (e.g., average, maximum, minimum).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty of the value. Allows to specify whether the uncertainty is absolute or relative.

samplePrepType.description: (Optional) - Describes the sample preparation process. Properties: preparationDate (Optional) - Date of the sample preparation, preparationDescription (Optional) - Short description of the sample preparation, preparationID (Optional) - Identifier of the sample preparation

preparationDescription.description: (Optional) - Short description of the sample preparation

instrumentDetails.description: (Required) - Details giving the relevant components and settings of the instrument.

instrumentManufacturer.description: (Optional) - Details about the manufacturer or vendor of the instrument

chamberPressure.description: (Required) - Pressure maintained inside the chamber (in which the sample is housed) during the measurement

imaging.description: (Required) - Details about the imaging settings of the instrument

detectors.description: (Required) - This group contains for SEM at least one detector, with the option to include a second one in case of signal mixing

eBeamDeceleration.description: (Optional) - Details about the instrument settings for electron-beam deceleration

FIB.description: (Optional) - Details about an additional Focused Oon Beam (FIB) extension to the instrument

manufacturerDetails.description: (Optional) - Details about the manufacturer or vendor of the instrument. Properties: manufacturerName (Optional) - Name of the manufacturer, modelName (Optional) - Model of the instrument, manufacturerID (Optional) - Identifier of the manufacturer

unit.description: (Required) - Unit of the value to be selected from a controlled list (Pa, hPa, kPa, MPa, GPa, mbar, bar, psi).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - Qualifier to describe the value (e.g., average, maximum, minimum).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty of the value. Allows to specify whether the uncertainty is absolute or relative.

sourceDetails.description: gives details about the electron beam source.

sourceName.description: (Optional) - name of the e-beam source of datatype string

accelerationVoltage.description: The potential difference between anode and cathode.

beamCurrent.description: Electrical current which flows along the beam path.

highCurrent.description: (Optional) - Is special control of the electron optics enabled to increase the specimen current? true or false

sourceLifetime.description: (Optional) - lifetime of the source (typical value - uAh) of datatype string

gunVacuum.description: (Optional) - Gives the pressure maintained in the electron gun

gunPressure.description: (Optional) - Gives the pressure maintained in the FIB gun

value.description: (Required) - The lifetime of the source expressed as an integer or floating point value of datatype number.

unit.description: (Required) - the unit of the value (typical unit - 쨉Ah).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - A qualifier to describe the value (e.g., avg, max, min).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty in the value defined separately as  uncertaintyDetails, which gives the option of choosing between an absolute uncertainty or relative uncertainty and entering the value of uncertainty as a number.

value.description: (Required) - The voltage expressed as an integer or floating point value of datatype number.

unit.description: (Required) - the unit of the value to be selected from a controlled list (쨉V, mV, V, kV, MV, GV).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - A qualifier to describe the value (e.g., avg, max, min).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty in the value defined separately as  uncertaintyDetails, which gives the option of choosing between an absolute uncertainty or relative uncertainty and entering the value of uncertainty as a number.

notes.description: (Optional) - Further notes about the value of datatype string

unit.description: (Required) - the unit of the value to be selected from a controlled list (pA, nA, uA, mA, A).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - A qualifier to describe the value (e.g., avg, max, min).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty in the value defined separately as  uncertaintyDetails, which gives the option of choosing between an absolute uncertainty or relative uncertainty and entering the value of uncertainty as a number.

stageDetails.description: Describes the stage settings during a measurement.

stageAlignmentDone.description: (Optional) - was stage alignment done? (check if true)

isCorrelationImage.description: (Optional) - Whether the image is used for correlating in xyz coordinates with another image? Check if true. If true the coordinates have to be entered for the sake of correlative characterization of datatype boolean

coordinates.description: (Optional) - the xyz coordinates of a point expressed separately as coordinateSet which allows entering each of the xyz coordinates along with their optional uncertainties. If correllation images (two reference spots) are available, the coordinates enable correlative microscopy and they need to be entered

coordinateReference.description: (Optional) - description of the reference used for defining the coordinates (for eg. - origin at centre of sample, distances from two edges, etc.)

stageTiltAngle.description: (Required) - angle by which the stage is actually tilted (Stage at T) defined separately as angleDetails with the angle value, optional uncertainty, optional notes, optional qualifier and choice of units between degree and radian

preTilt.description: (Optional) - predefined angle of a tilted sample holder which is tilted by design defined separately as angleDetails with the angle value, optional uncertainty, optional notes, optional qualifier and choice of units between degree and radian

tiltCorrectionAngle.description: (Optional) - angle used to correct the tilt of the sample defined separately as angleDetails with the angle value, optional uncertainty, optional notes, optional qualifier and choice of units between degree and radian

tiltCorrectionType.description: (Optional) - the tilt correction type applied to the image to compensate for the tilting, for e.g., sample surface, cross-section, none or manual, default value - none.

eBeamWorkingDistance.description: Distance which is determined along the optical axis within the column from (1) the lower end of the final optical element between the source and the specimen stage; to (2) the point where the beam is focused.

value.description: (Required) - The angle expressed as an integer or floating point value.

unit.description: (Required) - the unit of the value to be selected from a controlled list (degree, radian).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - A qualifier to describe the value (e.g., avg, max, mi).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty in the value defined separately as uncertaintyDetails, which gives the option of choosing between an absolute uncertainty or relative uncertainty and entering the value of uncertainty as a number.

imagingDetails.description: describes the imaging settings of the instrument during the measurement.

numberOfPixels.description: (Required) - The number of x, y pixels of the image, defined separately as pixelNumberType with separate entries for integer values of xPixels and yPixels

pixelSize.description: (Required) - Physical x,y,z length imaged by a single pixel, normally expressed in nm/pixel, defined separately as pixelSize3D for the mapping along x,y and z directions, with each pixel having a pixelSize, optional uncertainty, optional qualifier and optional notes. The y-pixel-size is to be given only if it is different from the x-pixel-size, and z-pixel-size can be ignored if it is greater than voxel size

collectionMethod.description: (Optional) - the method of collection of the image, for e.g., normal scan, average of multiple images, integration of multiple images, default value - normal scan.

dynamicFocus.description: (Optional) - To be set to true if dynamic focus is turned on, else false

apertureSetting.description: (Optional) - The setting for controlling the aperture size, using either the aperture size (directly) or the beam current (indirectly). The element apertureSetting is defined separately as apertureSettingType which gives the option to choose between current or size. If the size can be set directly, then it is defined with the complex type distanceDetails, else if the aperture setting is controlled with the beam current defined separately as currentDetails

dwellTime.description: Time period during which the beam remains at one position.

cycleTime.description: (Optional) - the time taken by the beam to scan a frame,  defined separately as  timeDetails. It is the time needed to scan a line times the number of lines in a frame.

noiseReduction.description: (Optional) - The type of noise reduction used as an enumerated list of six parameters: Pixel Avg, Line Avg, Frame Avg,  Pixel Int, Line Int, Frame Int.

voxel.description: (Optional) - Size of the voxel in case 3D imaging is done for Energy-dispersive X-ray Spectroscopy or Electron-backscatter Diffraction, defined separately as voxelDetails

coordinateSet.description: The set of xyz values describing a point of reference for correlative characterization.

coordinatesUnit.description: (Optional) - unit of the coordinates (allowed units - nm, 쨉m, mm, cm, m)

pixelNumberType.description: describes the resolution of the image split into number of pixels in x and y directions.

xPixels.description: (Required) - no. of pixels in horizontal direction of datatype number

yPixels.description: (Required) - no. of pixels in vertical direction of datatype number

apertureSettingType.description: The setting for controlling the aperture size, using either the aperture size directly or indirectly using the beam current. Therefore one of the two properties must be selected: size or current.

size.description: (Optional) - the size of the aperture which can be directly controlled using the instrument settings defined separately as distanceDetails

current.description: (Optional) - the beam current setting which would indirectly control the size of the aperture defined separately as currentDetails

pixelsize3D.description: the distance on the sample imaged by a single pixel, normally expressed in nm/pixel, is expressed in 3D for the mapping along x,y and z directions.

xPixelSize.description: (Required) -  distance on the sample covered by a pixel in the x direction defined separately as pixelSizeDetails

yPixelSize.description: (Optional) - distance on the sample covered by a pixel in the y direction defined separately as pixelSizeDetails; The y-pixel-size is to be given only if it is different from the x-pixel-size

zPixelSize.description: (Optional) - distance on the sample covered by a pixel in the z direction defined separately as pixelSizeDetails; The z-pixel-size can be ignored if it is greater than the voxel size

pixelSizeDetails.description: describes the size of a pixel.

value.description: (Required) - The pixel-size expressed as an integer or floating point value.

unit.description: (Required) - the unit of the value (typical unit - nm/pixel).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - A qualifier to describe the value (e.g., avg, max, min).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty in the value defined as a complex type uncertaintyDetails, which gives the option of choosing between an absolute uncertainty or relative uncertainty and entering the value of uncertainty as a number.

value.description: (Required) - The time expressed as an integer or floating point value of datatype number.

unit.description: (Required) - the unit of the value to be selected from a controlled list (ps, ns, 쨉s, ms, s).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - A qualifier to describe the value (e.g., avg, max, min).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty in the value defined as a complex type uncertaintyDetails, which gives the option of choosing between an absolute uncertainty or relative uncertainty and entering the value of uncertainty as a number.

voxelDetails.description: describes the size of a voxel.

value.description: (Required) - The voxel-size expressed as an integer or floating point value.

qualifier.description: (Optional) - A qualifier to describe the value (e.g., avg, max, min).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty in the value defined as a complex type uncertaintyDetails, which gives the option of choosing between an absolute uncertainty or relative uncertainty and entering the value of uncertainty as a number.

detectorSetDetails.description: gives information about signal mixing between two detectors and provides the information about the detector(s).

signalMixingDone.description: (Optional) - whether the detector signals are mixed, true or false, of datatype boolean

signalMixingDescription.description: (Optional) - Describes the purpose and technique of signal mixing of datatype string

detector1.description: (Required) - gives the settings of one detector defined separately as detectorDetails; entering the details of at least one detector is compulsory

detector2.description: (Optional) - gives the settings of a second detector defined separately as detectorDetails

detectorDetails.description: gives the settings of a detector.

detectorType.description: (Optional) - The type of detector (e.g., surface electron detection,  secondary electron, back-scattered electron) of datatype string

detectorName.description: (Required) -Name of the detector of datatype string

detectorManufacturer.description: (Optional) - describes the details of the detector (manufacturerName, modelName and detectorID) as part of manufacturerDetails

componentGeometry.description: (Optional) - xyz coordinates describing the position of the detector defined separately as coordinateSet

lastCalibration.description: (Optional) - date and time of last calibration (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ)

detectorBias.description: (Optional) - bias voltage applied to the detector defined separately as voltageDetails. Allowed units nV, uV, mV, V, kV

eBeamDecelerationDetails.description: Details about deceleration of the e- beam.

landingEnergy.description: (Optional) - Landing energy of the e-beam defined separately as energyDetails (allowed units - meV, eV, keV, nJ, mJ, J, kJ, MJ)

stageBias.description: (Optional) - Bias voltage applied to the stage defined separately biasDetails (allowed units - nV, uV, mV, V, kV, nA, uA, mA, A, kA)

value.description: (Required) - The energy expressed as an integer or floating point value.

unit.description: (Required) - the unit of the value to be selected from a controlled list (meV, eV, keV, MeV, nJ, 쨉J, mJ, J, kJ, MJ).

qualifier.description: (Optional) - A qualifier to describe the value (e.g., avg, max, min).

uncertainty.description: (Optional) - Uncertainty in the value defined separately as uncertaintyDetails giving the option of choosing between an absolute uncertainty or relative uncertainty and entering the value of uncertainty as a number

notes.description: (Optional) - Further notes about the value of datatype string

FIBDetails.description: Details about the focussed ion beam (FIB) extension if present.

FIBColumn.description: (Optional) - The name of the I-beam column used

angleToEBeam.description: (Optional) - angle between e-beam and i-beam defined separately as angleDetails (Allowed units: degree, radian)

iBeamSource.description: (Required) - describes the details of the FIB source, defined separately as sourceDetails in which it is important to note the accelerating voltage and beam current of the i-beam

FIBExtractor.description: (Required) - The extractor voltage used for the I-Beam

FIBProbe.description: (Required) - The settings used for the probe, extractor voltage:milling current. eg. 30kV:50pA

gasInjectionSystem.description: (Optional) - Details about the gas injection system (GIS) defined separately as GISDetails

iBeamWorkingDistance.description: (Optional) - Working distance of the ion beam (i-beam) defined separately as distanceDetails - this value needs to be entered if the i-beam focus has to be set independently from the e-beam focus (Allowed units: nm, um, mm, cm, m)

FIBSpotSize.description: (Optional) - spot size of the i-beam at the focus when the sample is in focus (also the spot size on the sample) defined separately as distanceDetails (Allowed units: nm, um, mm, cm, m)

GISDetails.description: gives the details of the gas injection system (GIS).

GISName.description: (Optional) - Name of the GIS system of datatype string

beamDepositionType.description: (Optional) - type of beam deposition of datatype string to choose between e-beam deposition and i-beam deposition

depositionCurrent.description: (Optional) - the current used for performing beam deposition defined separately as currentDetails (Allowed units pA,nA,uA,mA,A)

depositionSize.description: (Optional) - the size of the deposition defined separately as distanceDetails (Allowed units nm,um,mm,cm,m)

depositionTime.description: (Optional) - total time for deposition defined separately as timeDetails (Allowed units ps,ns,us,ms,s)
